intro: Inulanthera thodei, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in this family. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters, and are adapted for pollination by insects. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
